params.text:
KantanLQR

KantanLQR is a Language Quality Review tool that evaluates the quality of a machine translation engine using human evaluation. The goals of LQR are to:

  • Provide feedback on the quality of the output
  • Provide indications of how to spot and fix patterns of error
  • Choose the best engine available 

The LQR interface was designed with the purpose of automating the evaluation process as much as possible and faciliating results analysis. It was also intended to limit reviewer frustration by providing a designated tool for the evaulation process. 

There are three different project types on KantanLQR, each with their own goals.

A standard Quality Evaluation project lets the user benchmark quality using Key Performance Indicators (KPI's).

The A/B project is a comparative test that ranks up to four different outputs.

Finally, Post-Edit projects evaluate productivity by helping to measure time gain and edit distance. 

*Click on Hotspots (+) below to see more information for different features of the KantanLQR Tool.
This is where all of your LQR projects are displayed.
You can view the KPI's assigned to your project here.
You can view the Reviewers assigned to your project here.
You can view your Test Data for your project here.
Check your project details here (name, type, language pair, progress etc.).
This icon shows the project type (Quality Evaluation, A/B Test, Post-Edit).
Once your project is finished, you can check the Project Summary for a breakdown of the results.

params.textField:
Quality Evaluation projects let the user *benchmark quality* using *Key Performance Indicators*.

The *A/B project* is a comparative test that ranks up to four different outputs.

Post-Edit projects measure *productivity* by evaluating *time gain* and *edit distance*.

params.question: KantanLQR is a Language Quality Review tool that evaluates the quality of a machine translation engine using automated evaluation.

params.text:
Key Performance Indicators (KPI's)

Key Performance Indicators (KPI's) are qualitatve categories that provide Project Managers with quantitative analysis. The KPI's used in KantanLQR are a simplified set, taken from the MQM-DQF Framework and include: 

  • Overall Quality
  • Fluency
  • Adequacy
  • Style
  • Syntax and Grammar
  • Tech

There are two main kinds of KPI's that can be added to an LQR project, Stars and Multiple Choice. Stars are used for Overall Quality, Fluency, and Adequacy, while Multiple Choice are used for Style, Syntax and Grammar, and Tech. KPI's can be made compulsory or optional for reviewers, depending on their type.
KPI's with an asterisk beside them are compulsory, while KPI's with no aterisk are optional.

The 'Star' type of KPI is a simple rating out of 5 Stars, with 5 being the best and 1 being the worst. Hovering over the orange information symbol beside the KPI name will display a rating guide for reviewers.

The Multiple Choice KPI will display a drop list after clicking on the text box. Hovering over the orange information symbol beside the KPI name will display information about each of the multiple choice options.

choices.question: Which framework are the KantanLQR KPIs taken from?
What category do KantanLQR KPIs fall under?
What does an asterisk beside the KPI name indicate?
answers:
The KPI is compulsory and must be completed. 

The KPI is optional and must be completed.

The KPI is optional and can be completed as needed.
